Shield of the Immortal Forest.flavor: You awaken the slumbering spirits of the forest to protect your allies from harm.
Shield of the Immortal Forest.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you and your allies gain a +2 power bonus to all defenses while within 5 squares of your spirit companion. In addition, when an enemy hits an ally within 10 squares of you, you can use an immediate interrupt to end this effect and grant that ally a +6 bonus to all defenses against the attack.

Stone Root's Resilience.name: Stone Root's Resilience
Stone Root's Resilience.flavor: You grant an ally the resilience of the mountains to sustain blows that would cripple another creature.
Stone Root's Resilience.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the target gains temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier at the start of each of his or her turns.

Twilight's Veil.name: Twilight's Veil
Twilight's Veil.flavor: You reach into the spirit world, weaving together strands of primal night to cloak yourself and your allies in a veil of invisibility
Twilight's Veil.target: You and each ally in the burst
Twilight's Veil.effect: Each target becomes invisible until he or she attacks or until the end of your next turn.

Spirit of the Killing Shot.name: Spirit of the Killing Shot
Spirit of the Killing Shot.flavor: Your spirit companion briefly melds with your ally, lending your comrade the eye of an accomplished hunter.
Spirit of the Killing Shot.effect: The target makes a basic attack as a free action. If the attack hits, it deals maximum damage.
Spirit of the Killing Shot.stalkerSpirit: The target gains a bonus to the attack roll and the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Spirits of the Forsaken Vale.name: Spirits of the Forsaken Vale
Spirits of the Forsaken Vale.flavor: As your spirit companion attacks, spirits that look like wisps of bluish gray smoke spew from it, disorienting nearby foes.
Spirits of the Forsaken Vale.onHit: 3d8 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, any ally who makes an area or a close attack that includes your spirit companion in the area of effect gains combat advantage against each target of that attack.

Storm of War.name: Storm of War
Storm of War.flavor: You summon a windstorm created from the war cries of a thousand ancient battlefields to batter and distract your foe.
Storm of War.onHit: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier damage. Each enemy adjacent to your spirit companion grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Storm of War.worldSpeakerSpirit: Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain a bonus to damage rolls against any enemy adjacent to your spirit companion equal to your Constitution modifier.

Spirit Pin.name: Spirit Pin
Spirit Pin.flavor: You command your spirit companion to pin your foe in place.
Spirit Pin.onHit: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).
Spirit Pin.firstFailedSavingThrow: The target is restrained instead of immobilized (save ends).
Spirit Pin.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is immobilized (save ends).

Tree Father's Bounty.name: Tree Father's Bounty
Tree Father's Bounty.flavor: Trees erupt from the ground, battering your enemies and allowing your allies to skirt around the trunks to reach superior positions.
Tree Father's Bounty.effect: The burst creates a zone of trees that lasts until the end of the encounter. The zone is difficult terrain for your enemies. You and your allies gain cover while within the zone. When any ally starts his or her turn within the zone, you can use a free action to slide that ally 3 squares.

Boar's Toss.name: Boar's Toss
Boar's Toss.flavor: Your spirit companion slams your enemy through the air, leaving it open for your allies’ ranged attacks.
Boar's Toss.onHit: 1d10 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares. Then move your spirit companion to a square adjacent to it, and each ally within 10 squares of the target can make a ranged basic attack against it as a free action.
Boar's Toss.watcherSpirit: The allies gain a power bonus to the damage rolls of the ranged basic attacks equal to your Dexterity modifier.

Flesh Ripper's Claws.name: Flesh Ripper's Claws
Flesh Ripper's Claws.flavor: Your spirit companion slashes your foe, leaving it unbalanced and vulnerable to your ally’s attack.
Flesh Ripper's Claws.onHit: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier damage, and an ally adjacent to the target can make a melee basic attack against it as a free action. If that attack hits, the target is knocked prone.
Flesh Ripper's Claws.protectorSpirit: If the target stands up on its next turn, an ally adjacent to it can make a melee basic attack against it as a free action.

Ancestor's Drum.name: Ancestor's Drum
Ancestor's Drum.flavor: A spectral drum created by your ancestors manifests in your hands, thundering until you put it aside or until its power reaches a crescendo.
Ancestor's Drum.effect: One ally in the burst can spend a healing surge.
Ancestor's Drum.sustainStandard: The size of the burst increases by 1, and you make the attack again. After you use the power as a close burst 3, it can’t be sustained.

Tree Father's Ward.name: Tree Father's Ward
Tree Father's Ward.flavor: You call on Tree Father to punish your enemies for attacking and to reward your allies for fighting bravely.
Tree Father's Ward.target: One or two enemies in the blast
Tree Father's Ward.onHit: 3d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target takes a –4 penalty to attack rolls (save ends).
Tree Father's Ward.effect: Each bloodied ally in the blast regains hit points as if he or she had spent a healing surge.

Spirit of the Cunning General.name: Spirit of the Cunning General
Spirit of the Cunning General.flavor: The spirit of a legendary war leader settles on your form, inspiring your allies to mighty deeds.
Spirit of the Cunning General.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when any ally within 3 squares of your spirit companion spends an action point to make an attack and misses all targets with it, that ally regains the action point and can spend it again during this encounter.

Eagle's Aerie.name: Eagle's Aerie
Eagle's Aerie.flavor: Your spirit companion launches into the sky, diving on your enemies and herding them toward your allies.
Eagle's Aerie.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you slide the target 2 squares. The target grants combat advantage to your allies until the end of your next turn.
Eagle's Aerie.watcherSpirit: Until the end of your next turn, the target can’t gain the benefits of cover against your allies.

Spirit of the Ram.name: Spirit of the Ram
Spirit of the Ram.flavor: Your spirit companion transforms into a cluster of leaping ram spirits, which empower your allies to charge your foes.
Spirit of the Ram.effect: Each target can charge an enemy as a free action, with a +4 power bonus to the attack roll and a +5 bonus to the damage roll. If the charge attack hits, the target pushes the enemy 3 squares.
Spirit of the Ram.protectorSpirit: The number of squares the target pushes the enemy equals 2 + your Constitution modifier.

Spirit of the Vengeful Mountain.name: Spirit of the Vengeful Mountain
Spirit of the Vengeful Mountain.flavor: Your spirit companion manifests the essence of the impassable mountain, forming an impenetrable barrier against your foes
Spirit of the Vengeful Mountain.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target is restrained and can’t teleport.
Spirit of the Vengeful Mountain.worldSpeakerSpirit: Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain a bonus to attack rolls against the target equal to your Constitution modifier.

Stormhawk's Gambit.name: Stormhawk's Gambit
Stormhawk's Gambit.flavor: You call on the generosity of Stormhawk, sending your enemies crashing down with a blast of power and lifting you and your allies into the sky with primal grace.
Stormhawk's Gambit.onHit: 5d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target is slowed (save ends). A flying target crashes.
Stormhawk's Gambit.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when you or any ally starts his or her turn within 5 squares of your spirit companion, that character gains a fly speed equal to his or her speed and can hover until the end of his or her next turn.

Sunder Spirit.name: Sunder Spirit
Sunder Spirit.flavor: You drag your foe’s soul from its body and sever the connection, forcing your enemy to reestablish the link or perish. Your spirit companion then uses the foe’s life force to heal your allies.
Sunder Spirit.onHit: 3d10 + Wisdom modifier necrotic damage, and the target is knocked unconscious (save ends).
Sunder Spirit.eachFailedSavingThrow: Each ally adjacent to your spirit companion regains 5 hit points.
Sunder Spirit.thirdFailedSavingThrow: The target drops to 0 hit points.
Sunder Spirit.onMiss: Half damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Sunder Spirit.effect: Until the end of the encounter, any bloodied ally who starts his or her turn adjacent to your spirit companion regains 5 hit points.

Conquering Storm Spirit.name: Conquering Storm Spirit
Conquering Storm Spirit.flavor: Your spirit companion becomes a cyclone, which distracts your enemies and gives your allies more chances to strike.
Conquering Storm Spirit.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, the target provokes opportunity attacks when it makes any attack.
Conquering Storm Spirit.worldSpeakerSpirit: Until the end of your next turn, the target takes a penalty to attack rolls equal to your Constitution modifier.

Hunter in the Sky.name: Hunter in the Sky
Hunter in the Sky.flavor: You call on the spirit of the great sky hunter to slay your foe. As the spirit’s shadow moves across the battlefield, your foe’s attention is drawn to the danger lurking above.
Hunter in the Sky.onHit: 4d10 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain a +2 bonus to ranged attack rolls against the target while they are adjacent to your spirit companion.
Hunter in the Sky.watcherSpirit: The bonus to ranged attack rolls equals 1 + your Dexterity modifier.

Spiritblood Vines.name: Spiritblood Vines
Spiritblood Vines.flavor: Patches of red and green vines spring up from the ground, tangling your enemies. You can destroy a vine to release the primal energy it holds, healing a nearby ally.
Spiritblood Vines.effect: You conjure vines in four unoccupied squares in the burst. The vines last until the end of your next turn. When the vines appear, each vine makes the following attack. As a standard action, you can cause each vine to make the attack again. A creature can be hit by this power only once per round.
Spiritblood Vines.target: One creature adjacent to the vine
Spiritblood Vines.onHit: 3d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target is restrained (save ends).
Spiritblood Vines.sustainMinor: The vines persist, and you can destroy a vine. If you do so, one ally in that square or adjacent to it can either spend a healing surge or regain 20 hit points.

Spirit of Fiery Hatred.name: Spirit of Fiery Hatred
Spirit of Fiery Hatred.flavor: A spirit of burning hatred enters your foe and consumes it from the inside. When your enemy falls, your allies rejoice.
Spirit of Fiery Hatred.onHit: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier fire damage, and ongoing 15 fire damage (save ends). If this power reduces the target to 0 hit points, each ally adjacent to your spirit companion can spend a healing surge.
Spirit of Fiery Hatred.onMiss: Half damage, and ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends).
Spirit of Fiery Hatred.effect: Until the end of the encounter, when any ally adjacent to your spirit companion hits an enemy, that enemy takes ongoing 5 fire damage (save ends).

Spring's Laughter.name: Spring's Laughter
Spring's Laughter.flavor: A fresh breeze swirls around your enemy, confounding its attacks.
Spring's Laughter.onHit: The target takes a –2 penalty to saving throws, and the damage from its damage rolls is reduced to 0 (save ends both).

Massive Companion.name: Massive Companion
Massive Companion.flavor: Your spirit companion grows huge and solid, shaking off foes and sheltering your allies.
Massive Companion.onHit: 1d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target falls prone.
Massive Companion.effect: Until the end of the encounter, allies adjacent to your spirit companion gain cover against ranged, close, and area attacks.

Assistance of the Strong Spirit.name: Assistance of the Strong Spirit
Assistance of the Strong Spirit.flavor: You grant your spirit companion the mass and leverage it needs to drag a companion to safety.
Assistance of the Strong Spirit.target: One ally in the burst adjacent to your spirit companion or one object in the burst you can lift adjacent to your spirit companion
Assistance of the Strong Spirit.effect: You slide the target a number of squares equal to half your speed, and your spirit companion moves to a square adjacent to the target.

Herder of Hulculmak.name: Herder of Hulculmak
Herder of Hulculmak.flavor: Like a shepherd, you guide your flock to swim through the sea of flesh.
Herder of Hulculmak.target: You and each ally in the burst
Herder of Hulculmak.effect: Until the end of your next turn, each target can move through spaces occupied by your enemies.

Bear Hug.name: Bear Hug
Bear Hug.flavor: Your foe is surprised to be in the brutal embrace of your unexpectedly solid spirit companion.
Bear Hug.onHit: 1d6 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn or until your target is not adjacent to your spirit companion at the end of any turn, the target is restrained.

One Spirit, One Body.name: One Spirit, One Body
One Spirit, One Body.flavor: Drawing on the unity of body and spirit, you dissolve your flesh and reform it in the place where your spirit companion stood.
One Spirit, One Body.requirement: Your spirit companion must be within 10 squares of you.
One Spirit, One Body.effect: You and your spirit companion trade places.

Behemoth's Club.name: Behemoth's Club
Behemoth's Club.flavor: Your spirit companion looms tall and solid enough to pick up one of your foes and use it to batter another.
Behemoth's Club.effect: Until the end of your next turn, your spirit companion grows to size Large. If your spirit companion has insufficient space to increase in size, this power automatically fails.
Behemoth's Club.primaryTarget: One creature of Large size or smaller
Behemoth's Club.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage. Until the end of your next turn, your spirit companion grabs the target. Make a secondary attack.
Behemoth's Club.secondaryTarget: One creature adjacent to your spirit companion or to the primary target
Behemoth's Club.secondaryOnHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target falls prone. The primary target also takes 5 + Wisdom modifier damage.

Spirit of Consuming Terror.name: Spirit of Consuming Terror
Spirit of Consuming Terror.flavor: The form a spirit takes is a habit of mind. You overcome that habit and morph your spirit companion into a terrifying form, which you send against your foe.
Spirit of Consuming Terror.effect: Until the end of your next turn, the target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against allies that are adjacent to your spirit companion.
Spirit of Consuming Terror.sustainStandard: Repeat the attack against the same or a different target.

Infectious Spark.name: Infectious Spark
Infectious Spark.flavor: Your spirit companion dissolves when struck, leaving its mind behind to compel your enemy to an undesired action.
Infectious Spark.trigger: Your spirit companion is hit by a melee attack
Infectious Spark.onHit: 1d8 + Wisdom modifier psychic damage, and the target makes a melee basic attack against an enemy of your choice. Your spirit companion disappears, and you take no damage from the spirit companion disappearing.

Roaming Mind, Roving Spirit.name: Roaming Mind, Roving Spirit
Roaming Mind, Roving Spirit.flavor: By sharing a part of your intellect with your spirit companion, your spirit companion gains the ability to act independently and you can perceive with its senses.
Roaming Mind, Roving Spirit.effect: Until the end of the encounter, you do not need line of sight or line of effect to your spirit companion, and can move your spirit companion beyond its normal range. You perceive the surroundings of your spirit companion as if you were in its place. You cannot make attacks through your spirit companion when you do not have line of effect to the spirit companion or when it is further than 20 squares away.

Gray Roarer's Rampage.name: Gray Roarer's Rampage
Gray Roarer's Rampage.flavor: Your spirit companion passes through the heads of your foes like a whirlwind, scattering their thoughts and directing their movement.
Gray Roarer's Rampage.effect: Your spirit companion can move 4 squares as part of this attack. During this movement, it can pass through squares occupied by your enemies.
Gray Roarer's Rampage.target: Each enemy whose space your spirit companion entered as part of this movement
Gray Roarer's Rampage.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier psychic damage, you slide the target 1 square, and the target is dazed (save ends).
Gray Roarer's Rampage.onMiss: Half damage, and the target grants combat advantage to your allies until the end of your next turn.

Spirit of the Brain Mole.name: Spirit of the Brain Mole
Spirit of the Brain Mole.flavor: Your spirit companion leaps at your foe’s head, shrinking as it travels until it is just the right size to disappear into the enemy’s brain and take over.
Spirit of the Brain Mole.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier psychic damage, and the target is dominated (save ends). When the target saves against being dominated, your spirit companion appears in a space adjacent to the target.
Spirit of the Brain Mole.onMiss: Half damage, and the target makes a basic attack against a creature of your choice.

Spirit's Sacrifice.name: Spirit's Sacrifice
Spirit's Sacrifice.flavor: Seeing an ally in need, you sacrifice your spirit companion to give your ally a needed boost.
Spirit's Sacrifice.target: You or one ally in the burst
Spirit's Sacrifice.effect: You dismiss the spirit companion and the target makes a saving throw or gains temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Winter's Thaw.name: Winter's Thaw
Winter's Thaw.flavor: Fire blossoms in your spirit companion and sends flaming cinders into the air to relax winter’s bitter grasp.
Winter's Thaw.effect: Center a burst 2 on your spirit companion. The burst becomes a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any ally that starts its turn in the zone and is slowed, immobilized, or taking ongoing cold damage makes a saving throw. On a success, one of those conditions ends.

Remembrance of Hate.name: Remembrance of Hate
Remembrance of Hate.flavor: The spirits recall the ancient offenses done to the world and vent their hatred through claw and fang.
Remembrance of Hate.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and ongoing 5 damage (save ends).
Remembrance of Hate.onMiss: Half damage, and you push the target 1 square from your spirit companion.
Remembrance of Hate.effect: The burst becomes a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter or until your spirit companion is no longer present in the encounter. Any creature starting its turn in the zone takes 3 damage and you push the target 1 square from your spirit companion.

Primal Investiture.name: Primal Investiture
Primal Investiture.flavor: You merge your spirit companion with an ally to grow his or her strength.
Primal Investiture.range: Area burst 5 centered on spirit companion
Primal Investiture.effect: You dismiss the spirit companion and you cannot use call spirit companion until the end of your next turn. The target can spend a healing surge and gains a +1 power bonus to attack rolls and a +2 power bonus to all defenses until the end of the encounter.

Emerald Lure.name: Emerald Lure
Emerald Lure.flavor: Bright emerald motes fill the air around your spirit companion and lure your enemies to the companion.
Emerald Lure.onHit: 1d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you pull the target 1 square toward your spirit companion. You dismiss your spirit companion.

Enraged Spirit.name: Enraged Spirit
Enraged Spirit.flavor: Your spirit companion warps and writhes until it becomes something monstrous—a vision of vengeance.
Enraged Spirit.effect: Your spirit companion transforms into the spirit of vengeance until the end of the encounter or until your spirit companion is no longer present in the encounter. While in this form, your spirit companion gains resist 5 to all damage, and you can use the Enraged Spirit Attack power at will.
Enraged Spirit.requirement: The power Enraged Spirit must be active in order to use this power.
Enraged Spirit.onHit: 1d12 + Wisdom modifier damage, and if the secondary target deals any damage before the end of your next turn, it takes 1d12 extra damage.

Call Forth the Spirit World.name: Call Forth the Spirit World
Call Forth the Spirit World.flavor: Your enemies cannot bear the spirit world’s wonder, but your allies find themselves reinvigorated.
Call Forth the Spirit World.effect: The burst becomes a zone until the end of your next turn or until your spirit companion is destroyed. The zone moves with the spirit companion, remaining centered on its space. Enemies within the zone take a -2 penalty to attack rolls. Any bloodied ally that starts its turn within the zone regains 5 hit points.

Harvest Reaping.name: Harvest Reaping
Harvest Reaping.flavor: Vengeful spirits hold your enemy fast to steal its strength for your allies to use.
Harvest Reaping.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.
Harvest Reaping.effect: Whenever you use healing spirit before the end of your next turn, each ally adjacent to your spirit companion gains a +2 power bonus to melee damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn.

Spiritual Congress.name: Spiritual Congress
Spiritual Congress.flavor: Calling forth the spirits to gain their wisdom, you bind them to you so their aid continues for a time.
Spiritual Congress.effect: Until the end of the encounter, after using speak with spirits you regain the use of speak with spirits at the end of your next turn.

Winter's End.name: Winter's End
Winter's End.flavor: Winter flees the fires wreathing your spirit companion, bringing new hope and zeal to the allies bathed in its glow.
Winter's End.effect: The burst becomes a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any ally that starts its turn in the zone and is slowed, immobilized, or taking ongoing cold damage makes a saving throw for each such condition. On a success, that condition ends.

Spirit of Endings Begun.name: Spirit of Endings Begun
Spirit of Endings Begun.flavor: Darkness swirls out from your spirit companion, eroding your enemies’ defenses and stealing their life.
Spirit of Endings Begun.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage. The target takes ongoing 5 damage and a -2 penalty to all defenses (save ends both).
Spirit of Endings Begun.onMiss: Half damage, and you push the target 1 square from your spirit companion.
Spirit of Endings Begun.effect: The burst becomes a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter or until your spirit companion is no longer present in the encounter. Any creature that starts its turn in the zone takes 5 damage and you push the target 1 square from your spirit companion.

Beguiling Call.name: Beguiling Call
Beguiling Call.flavor: Drawn by your spirit companion’s inviting aspect, your foes soon learn their error when it strikes.
Beguiling Call.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier psychic damage. You pull the target 1 square toward your spirit companion, and the target is dazed until the end of your next turn. You dismiss your spirit companion.

Spirit of Destruction.name: Spirit of Destruction
Spirit of Destruction.flavor: The ground trembles as your spirit companion gathers power to complete its transformation into destruction incarnate. Where it goes, ruin follows.
Spirit of Destruction.effect: Your spirit companion transforms into the spirit of destruction until the end of the encounter, until you dismiss it, or until it is destroyed. While in this form, your spirit companion gains resist 10 to all damage, and you can use the Spirit of Destruction Attack at will.
Spirit of Destruction.requirement: The power Spirit of Destruction must be active in order to use this power.
Spirit of Destruction.onHit: 2d12 + Wisdom modifier damage. You push the secondary target 2 squares away from your spirit companion, and you knock the target prone.

Deep Roots.name: Deep Roots
Deep Roots.flavor: Green shoots sprout up from the earth and bind your foes in place. Where they hold your enemy, they drain away strength and bestow it onto your allies.
Deep Roots.onHit: The target is immobilized and weakened until the end of your next turn.
Deep Roots.effect: Whenever you use healing spirit before the end of your next turn, each ally adjacent to your spirit companion gains a +5 power bonus to melee damage rolls until the end of his or her next turn.

Spirit's Wrath.name: Spirit's Wrath
Spirit's Wrath.flavor: Burning hatred drives your spirit to smash into your enemy.
Spirit's Wrath.trigger: An enemy leaves a square adjacent to your spirit companion without shifting.
Spirit's Wrath.onHit:
1d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target grants combat advantage until the end of your next turn.
Level 21: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier damage.

Spirit Infusion.name: Spirit Infusion
Spirit Infusion.flavor: You dismiss your spirit companion, which flows into an ally and enables him or her to make a swift and sudden attack.
Spirit Infusion.effect: Your spirit companion disappears, and the target can make a basic attack with a +2 power bonus to the attack roll and a power bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Scorching Sands.name: Scorching Sands
Scorching Sands.flavor: Sands infused with desert fire pour out from your spirit companion, splashing an enemy with terrible flames as your companion dissipates.
Scorching Sands.onHit: 1d8 + Wisdom modifier fire damage, and the target gains vulnerable 5 fire until the end of your next turn.
Scorching Sands.elementalSpirit: You and each ally adjacent to your spirit companion can choose to deal fire damage until the end of your next turn. This fire damage replaces an attack’s normal damage types.

Dust Storm Binding.name: Dust Storm Binding
Dust Storm Binding.flavor: Your spirit companion explodes in an obscuring cloud of dust, sand, and silt that blinds and stings your foes.
Dust Storm Binding.onMiss: The target takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of your next turn.
Dust Storm Binding.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Squares within the zone are heavily obscured. Any enemy that starts its turn within the zone takes 5 damage.

Condensation.name: Condensation
Condensation.flavor: Moisture gathers in the air around your spirit companion as you fuse its form with one of your allies to provide healing and a protective barrier against the elements.
Condensation.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The target gains resist 10 fire and regeneration equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of the encounter or until you use call spirit companion.

Granite Armor.name: Granite Armor
Granite Armor.flavor: Your spirit companion enters your ally’s body, encasing your comrade in a stony sheath and sending rocky shards flying outward.
Granite Armor.effect: Your spirit companion disappears, and the primary target gains resist 3 to all damage until the end of your next turn. Make an attack that is a close burst 1 centered on the primary target.
Granite Armor.elementalSpirit: The resistance equals 2 + your Intelligence modifier.

Shrieking Wind Spirits.name: Shrieking Wind Spirits
Shrieking Wind Spirits.flavor: The shrieking desert winds gather about your spirit companion, which you then dismiss to unleash a storm that leaves your enemies reeling.
Shrieking Wind Spirits.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you slide the primary target 3 squares. The primary target is dazed (save ends).
Shrieking Wind Spirits.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While the zone persists, you can use the Shrieking Wind Attack power using the burst’s origin square as the power’s origin square.
Shrieking Wind Spirits.requirement: The power Shrieking Wind Spirits must be active in order to use this power.
Shrieking Wind Spirits.trigger: An enemy ends its turn within the zone.
Shrieking Wind Spirits.secondaryTarget: The triggering enemy in the burst
Shrieking Wind Spirits.secondaryOnHit: You slide the secondary target 3 squares.

Light of the Crimson Sun.name: Light of the Crimson Sun
Light of the Crimson Sun.flavor: Your spirit erupts in flames, shining with coruscating light that empowers some of your allies’ attacks.
Light of the Crimson Sun.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. While within the zone, your allies gain a +2 power bonus to attack rolls with fire powers and radiant powers. In addition, whenever an ally hits with a fire power or a radiant power while within the zone, he or she gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Memories of WInd and Rain.name: Memories of WInd and Rain
Memories of WInd and Rain.flavor: You dismiss your spirit companion and unleash wind and rain spirits that shriek as they descend on your enemies. Gusts of wind shove your allies about while slamming any enemies that come too close.
Memories of WInd and Rain.effect: Your spirit companion disappears, and you slide each ally in the burst 1 square. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Any enemy that ends its turn within the zone is dazed until the end of its next turn.

Mountain's Might.name: Mountain's Might
Mountain's Might.flavor: When your spirit merges with your ally, the ground trembles and knocks foes from their feet. That ally then assumes a rocky form that is slow but resilient.
Mountain's Might.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. Until the end of your next turn, the primary target assumes the form of mountain’s might. While in this form, the primary target is slowed, gains resist 5 to all damage, and gains a power bonus to melee damage rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier. The primary target can end the effect as a minor action. Make an attack that is a close burst 1 centered on the primary target.
Mountain's Might.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the secondary target falls prone.
Mountain's Might.sustainMinor: The form of mountain’s might persists.

Swirling Dust.name: Swirling Dust
Swirling Dust.flavor: Your spirit companion enters your ally’s body, and nothing remains of either except swirling dust.
Swirling Dust.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. Until the end of your next turn, the target is insubstantial, and its space and any squares adjacent to it are lightly obscured.

Seething Zephyr.name: Seething Zephyr
Seething Zephyr.flavor: Winds gather around your spirit companion, which bursts into a zephyr that scatters your enemies and sends one of your allies flying.
Seething Zephyr.onHit: 2d10 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you slide the target 1 square.
Seething Zephyr.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. If you hit at least one target, one ally in the burst can fly 6 squares.

Volcanic Circle.name: Volcanic Circle
Volcanic Circle.flavor: Your spirit companion disappears into the ground, where it awakens the angry earth and unleashes bubbling fire and molten rock.
Volcanic Circle.onHit: 1d10 + Wisdom modifier fire damage, and the target grants combat advantage and takes ongoing 10 fire damage (save ends both).
Volcanic Circle.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Squares within the zone are lightly obscured. Any creature that ends its turn within the zone takes 10 fire damage.

Guiding Winds.name: Guiding Winds
Guiding Winds.flavor: The gentle breeze swirling around your spirit companion intensifies, pushing your allies to confront an enemy.
Guiding Winds.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. You slide each target a number of squares equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Cloudburst.name: Cloudburst
Cloudburst.flavor: Your spirit companion dissolves into roiling black clouds that loose lightning and slashing rain.
Cloudburst.onHit: 2d6 + Wisdom modifier lightning damage, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Cloudburst.elementalSpirit: You and each ally in the burst can choose to deal lightning damage until the end of your next turn. This lightning damage replaces an attack’s normal damage types.

Sirocco Spirit.name: Sirocco Spirit
Sirocco Spirit.flavor: Your elemental spirit breaks apart to become a storm of dust and wind that blinds your enemies and makes them more susceptible to attacks.
Sirocco Spirit.onHit: 2d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and the target is blinded and gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends both).
Sirocco Spirit.onMiss: Half damage, and the target gains vulnerable 5 to all damage (save ends).

Sand Summons.name: Sand Summons
Sand Summons.flavor: You dismiss your spirit companion, using its power to cause sand to boil up from the ground. The sands consume your allies and deliver them to safety while leaving an area of unstable terrain.
Sand Summons.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. You teleport each target 5 squares. The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter.

Boulder Smash.name: Boulder Smash
Boulder Smash.flavor: As your spirit moves, it transforms into a rolling boulder that smashes through your enemies’ ranks before disappearing.
Boulder Smash.onHit: 3d8 + Wisdom modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.
Boulder Smash.elementalSpirit: The burst creates a zone of difficult terrain that lasts until the end of the encounter or until you use call spirit companion.

Caustic Rain.name: Caustic Rain
Caustic Rain.flavor: Your spirit companion dissolves into acrid green clouds that wash the battlefield with acid rain and funnel life from your enemies into your allies.
keywords: Acid, Healing, Implement, Primal, Spirit, Zone
Caustic Rain.onHit: 3d6 + Wisdom modifier acid damage, and the target takes a -2 penalty to all defenses and ongoing 15 acid damage (save ends both).
Caustic Rain.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Squares within the zone are lightly obscured. Any creature that ends its turn within the zone takes 15 acid damage. Whenever this zone reduces a nonminion enemy to 0 hit points, one ally you can see can spend a healing surge.

Immolating Spirit.name: Immolating Spirit
Immolating Spirit.flavor: Your spirit companion merges with your ally, causing your comrade to erupt in flames as he or she delivers a sudden attack.
Immolating Spirit.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. The target can use a free action either to make a melee basic attack or to charge. If this attack hits, the target deals 2d10 extra fire damage and can spend a healing surge.
Immolating Spirit.elementalSpirit: If the target’s attack hits, each enemy adjacent to the target takes fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Fury of Athas.name: Fury of Athas
Fury of Athas.flavor: You dismiss your spirit companion and use its power to call forth the world spirit’s tattered remnants, empowering your allies to launch a brutal assault.
Fury of Athas.effect: Your spirit companion disappears. Each target can make a basic attack as a free action. If this attack hits, the target of the attack is stunned and takes ongoing 10 damage (save ends both).

Four-Armed is Forewarned.name: Four-Armed is Forewarned
Four-Armed is Forewarned.flavor: You channel the many-armed thri-kreen spirit through your ally, allowing him or her to strike with speed and ferocity.
Four-Armed is Forewarned.effect: The target can make a melee basic attack against up to four enemies adjacent to it as a free action.

Ancient Progenitor Spirit.name: Ancient Progenitor Spirit
Ancient Progenitor Spirit.sourceRef: Into the Unknown: The Dungeon Survival Handbook
Ancient Progenitor Spirit.flavor: With a low hum, your spirit companion fades and the essence of an ancient ancestor comes to your aid, invading the minds of enemies foolish enough to stay close.
Ancient Progenitor Spirit.onHit: 1d10 + Wisdom modifier psychic damage, and the target grants combat advantage and cannot benefit from any concealment (save ends both).
Ancient Progenitor Spirit.effect: Your spirit companion disappears, and the burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of your next turn. Enemies in the zone take a -2 penalty to attack rolls, and any enemy that ends its turn in the zone takes 5 psychic damage.
Ancient Progenitor Spirit.sustainMinor: The zone persists until the end of your next turn.
